poem:
**Screen Illusions**  

An escape from ink,  
a drawn breath into life—  
tales of past and loss collide,  
televisions hum with  
ghostly longing.  

In this vivid dance  
between reality and dream,  
the walls, thin as paper,  
cradle whispers of tomorrow;  
sketches unfold history,  
truth drawn in shadow and light,  
worlds made whole  
in the flicker  
of a screen.
